Source code for snow_water_equivalent

# -*- coding: utf-8 -*-
"""Snow Storage Class."""

import numpy as np
from core.verticalwaterbalance import numba_snow_water_content as nb_sw



[docs]class Snow():
    """Compute snow storage and related fluxes.

    Parameters
    ----------
    elevation : array
        Land surface elevation map based on GTOPO30 (U.S.
        Geological Survey, 1996) [1]_.
    degreeday : array
        Land cover specific degreeday values based on [2]_ .
    precipitation : array
        Daily precipitation,  Units: mm/day

        References.

        .. [1] U.S. Geological Survey: USGS EROS archive – digital elevation–
                    global 30 arc-second elevation (GTOPO30), available at:
                    https://www.usgs.gov/centers/eros/science/usgs-eros-archivedigital-elevation-global-30-arc-second-elevation-gtopo30?qtscience_center_objects=0#qt-science_center_objects
                    (last access: 25 MArch 2020), 1996

        .. [2] Müller Schmied, H., Cáceres, D., Eisner, S., Flörke, M.,
                    Herbert, C., Niemann, C., Peiris, T. A., Popat, E.,
                    Portmann, F. T., Reinecke, R., Schumacher, M., Shadkam, S.,
                    Telteu, C.E., Trautmann, T., & Döll, P. (2021).
                    The global water resources and use model WaterGAP v2.2d:
                    model description and evaluation. Geoscientific Model
                    Development, 14(2), 1037–1079.
                    https://doi.org/10.5194/gmd-14-1037-2021

    Notes
    -----
    See method **cal_snow** for additonal input parameters

    Methods
    -------
    cal_snow:
        Compute daily snow storage.

    """

    def __init__(self, static_data, precipitation):

        parameters = static_data.canopy_model_parameters
        land_cover = static_data.land_cover

        self.degreeday = np.zeros(land_cover.shape) * np.nan
        for i in range(len(parameters)):
            self.degreeday[land_cover[:, :] == parameters.loc[i, 'Number']] = \
                parameters.loc[i, 'degree-day']

        self.elevation = static_data.gtopo30_elevation

        self.precipitation = precipitation


[docs]    def cal_snow(self, land_area_frac, temperature, throughfall,
                 snow_water_storage, pet_to_soil, land_storage_change_sum,
                 thresh_elev, snow_water_storage_subgrid):
        """
        Compute daily snow storage.

        Parameters
        ----------
        land_area_frac : array
            Land area fraction, Units: %.
        temperature : array
            Daily temperature climate forcing, Units: K.
        throughfall : array
            Throughfall, Units: mm
        snow_water_storage : array
           Snow water storage, Units: mm
        pet_to_soil : array
            Remaining energy for addtional evaporation from soil, Units: mm
        land_storage_change_sum : array
                Sum of change in vertical balance storages, Units: mm
        thresh_elev : array
            Elevation threshold to prevent excessive snow accumaltion, Units: m
        snow_water_storage_subgrid : array
            Snow water storage divided into 100 subgrids based on GTOPO30 (U.S.
            Geological Survey, 1996) land surface elevation map, Units: mm

        Returns
        -------
        snow_water_storage : array
            Snow water storage, Units: mm
        snow_water_storage_subgrid : array
            Snow water storage divided into 100 subgrids based on GTOPO30 (U.S.
            Geological Survey, 1996) land surface elevation map, Units: mm
        thresh_elev : array
            Elevation threshold to prevent excessive snow accumaltion, Units: m
        snow_fall : array
            Snowfall, Units: mm
        sublimation : array
            Sublimation, Units: mm
        snow_melt : array
            Snow melt, Units: mm
        effective_precipitation : array
            Effective Precipitation, Units: mm/day
        max_temp_elev : array
            Maximum temperature from the 1st(lowest) elevation, Units: K
        land_storage_change_sum : array
            Sum of change in vertical balance storages, Units: mm
        """
        elevation = self.elevation
        precipitation = self.precipitation
        degreeday = self.degreeday

        # =====================================================================
        # Defining additional ouput variables: snow fall(mm),sublimation(mm),
        # snow_melt(mm), effective_precipitation(mm)
        # =====================================================================
        snow_fall = np.zeros(thresh_elev.shape)
        sublimation = np.zeros(thresh_elev.shape)
        snow_melt = np.zeros(thresh_elev.shape)
        effective_precipitation = np.zeros(thresh_elev.shape)
        max_temp_elev = np.zeros(thresh_elev.shape)

        nb_sw.numba_snow(degreeday, land_area_frac, elevation,
                         snow_water_storage_subgrid, thresh_elev, temperature,
                         precipitation, throughfall, pet_to_soil,
                         land_storage_change_sum, snow_water_storage,
                         snow_fall, sublimation, snow_melt,
                         effective_precipitation, max_temp_elev)

        return snow_water_storage, snow_water_storage_subgrid, thresh_elev,\
            snow_fall, sublimation, snow_melt, effective_precipitation,\
            max_temp_elev, land_storage_change_sum,
